definition: to force someone to do something
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: But this is obviously an outrageous demand given China's stable development strategy.
sentences.chinese: 這在中國追求穩定發展之際無疑是強人所難，此其一。

sentences.english: Thus we become greedy, stingy, and inconsiderate.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我們變得貪婪，吝嗇，和強人所難。

sentences.english: He knew what he wanted to say, but the actual articulation was difficult for him.
sentences.chinese: 英語準確的音節對於他來說是有些強人所難。

sentences.english: I regard it as an imposition.

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
red in the face/extremely angry
dejected/despondent/depressed
to become a mere formality
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
